intro: Pachycalyx inaequalis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock fig, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow or red when mature. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
